result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan R Fuss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge= $543  to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 2/1/17 and on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
Apply cash bail toward payment of costs.

FORTHWITH
--serve  20 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith.

-- Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

--On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in uncharged referrals:   Bailjumping (DA Case #16JE1487) with a date of violation of 5/21/16, and Bailjumping with a date of violation of 11/23/16 in the City of Watertown, involving consumption of alcohol, and thereafter the Court bars further prosecution of these referrals.  

--The Court requires DNA sample provision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan R Fuss

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: cc: Defendant , DA(electronically) , JESO  1-19-17  /tn
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission
Criminal Case Settlement
Huber Law/Work Release Notification

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 3:16pm. 
Defendant Dylan R Fuss in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Fuss indicates that he learned that he will not be accepted into the First Offender Program.  He wishes to proceed to Plea & Sentencing today. 
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance. 
The Court provides Mr. Fuss with a Guilty Plea Questionnaire document and instructs him to complete the form. 
recess 3:21pm, reconvene 3:32pm
The Court notes that Mr. Fuss was previously found to be competent to represent himself.  
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Fuss, verifying that he understands and joins in the agreement. 
Mr. Fuss indicates that he is rejecting Probation 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in uncharged referrals:   Bailjumping (DA Case #16JE1487) with a date of violation of 5/21/16, and Bailjumping with a date of violation of 11/23/16 in the City of Watertown, involving consumption of alcohol, and thereafter the Court bars further prosecution of these referrals.  

The Court sentences Mr. Fuss to:
--serve  20 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge= $543  to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 2/1/17 and on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
The Court requires DNA sample provision. 
Apply cash bail toward payment of costs.
recess 3:50pm
Status conference on January 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 7, 2016 at 08:40 am.

[MK] case called at 1:46pm. 
Defendant Dylan R Fuss in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Right to counsel given. Constructive waiver of counsel warnings are given. 
Mr. Fuss waives his right to counsel. 
The Court accepts Mr. Fuss' waiver of his right counsel, finding him competent to represent himself.  
The Court continues the Bond and conditions of Bond. 
recess 1:50pm.

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 12/7/16 at 8:40am,  (2) Status Conference on 1/13/17 at 3:00pm
Set for Status - RRK cc: All
Status conference on November 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
FOP Revocation Letter
Court's Response to Notice of Case Acceptance in FOP - OK
Notice of Case Acceptance into First Offender Program for 12 months
Status conference on May 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2016 at 08:20 am.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Amended Bond

[MK] case called at 11:09am 
Defendant Dylan R Fuss in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Fuss provides a new address in Watertown:  1321 Utah Street.
Mr. Fuss verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $150 Cash Bond (already posted), with conditions: 
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence 
--no discussion of the case with Ashley Hartley
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to take any controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescription drugs only as prescribed
recess 11:14am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/6/16 at 8:20am  (2)  Status Conference on 5/6/16 at 1:15pm
